intro: Argyra, commonly known as silverleaf, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. These plants are characterized by their finely divided, silvery-gray foliage that reflects light, giving them their distinctive appearance. Argyra species typically grow in temperate regions and are often found in meadows or along woodland edges. The flowers are small and clustered, usually white or pale yellow, and they produce small, dry fruits. Due to their ornamental value and medicinal properties, some species of Argyra are cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
